TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DbProviderSpecificTypePropertyAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies which provider-specific property in the strongly typed parameter classes is to be used when setting a provider-specific type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Common.DbProviderSpecificTypePropertyAttribute> is used by a provider writer to designate a provider-specific type parameter property which is not inherited from the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbParameter> base class. The <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter.SqlDbType%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter> is an example of a provider-specific type property not found in `DbParameter`.
A provider writer can apply `DbProviderSpecificTypePropertyAttribute(true)` to indicate a provider-specific data type parameter property. This allows for its discovery using reflection, which enables code generation tools, such as those used in Visual Studio, to generate code geared to a specific provider. The <xref:System.Data.Common.DbProviderSpecificTypePropertyAttribute.IsProviderSpecificTypeProperty%2A> property returns `true` if the property has been set, otherwise `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isProviderSpecificTypeProperty) cil managed

Docs.param: Specifies whether this property is a provider-specific property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a class.
Indicates whether the attributed property is a provider-specific type.
Docs.value: if the property that this attribute is applied to is a provider-specific type property; otherwise .
